basics.name: William Liang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

courses: ICS 241: Discrete Math II for CS
ICS 141: Discrete Math I for CS

work.summary: Intern under eWorld's Department of Transportation Harbors project developing and maintaining port tracking system
highlights: Collaborate with the Department of Transportation to implement their web application for control of ships at harbors around Hawaii.
Use Vue, Java, and other varioustechnologiesto implement functionality for DoT Harbors application.
Create teststo verify the functionality of newly implemented code.

work.summary: Support development of web application for UH Manoa
highlights: Contribute to the development of UI and API functionality on UH Groupings project.
Implement varioustechnologies and frameworkssuch as Bootstrap and JavaScript to upkeep applications.
Increase JavaScript Jasmine test coverage from 10% to 90%.
Assisted in developing VR applications through Unity.
Reported status, deadlines, issues and achievements to Program Management.
Summarized and presented internship learning and experience to the leadership team.

Projects.title: Warrior Ride Buddies
highlights: Built a full-stack web app with a team of 4 othersto connect users and assist in scheduling carpoolschedules.
Utilized Google Maps API to feature a functional map and user locations for easy identification.
Allows for direct messages between single or multiple users to communicate to schedule carpool plans.
Tech stack: JavaScript, HTML/CSS, React, Semantic UI, Google Maps API, Meteor, MongoDB

Projects.title: UH Groupings
Projects.summary: UH Groupings is a web application that allows the user to communicate with certain groups within the University of Hawaii system i.e. (e.g., all full-time Hilo faculty). Some features include including and excluding certain subgroups
highlights: Tech stack: Apache Maven, Apache Tomcat, Java Spring Framework, Spring Boot, Spring Security, Thymeleaf, Bootstrap, AngularJS, JQuery, Jasmine, Jenkins, Underscore.js

awards.title: UH Manoa Summer First-Year Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to freshman and sophomore students with a 3.5 GPA.
